intro: Zygia dissitiflora, commonly known as the scattered-flowered zygia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its stems are usually woody and branching. Zygia dissitiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
